localize.title: The New York Times Trends
localize.description: See what's buzzing on The New York Times in your native language

nodes.title:
President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine will ask Congress for aid as Russia bombards his country.

Watch his speech live with analysis from our reporters.
https://t.co/1G5f6dFJwN
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: President Biden plans to announce an additional $800 million in security assistance to Ukraine on Wednesday, White House officials said, only hours after President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine is scheduled to address Congress. https://t.co/a5AuDQLWck
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine made an urgent and emotional appeal to Congress on Wednesday to come to his countryâ€™s aid as it fights off a brutal Russian invasion. "We need you right now," he said. https://t.co/8zKJVziBSp https://t.co/sa82CAqCB2
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday referred to pro-Western Russians as â€œscum and traitorsâ€ who needed to be removed from society, setting the stage for an ever fiercer crackdown at home and even more aggression abroad. https://t.co/wQlF4z7dFR
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: The mayor of the Ukrainian city of Melitopol, who was dragged from his office with bag over his head last week by Russian troops, has been freed, according to the head of the Ukrainian presidential administration. https://t.co/N1dyvZfj3Y
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Olga Smirnova, a Russian ballerina at the Bolshoi, said she was leaving for the Dutch National Ballet. She is one of the most significant cultural figures to leave Russia because of the invasion and said she opposed the war "with all the fibers of my soul."https://t.co/wZ4BqCd9Kj
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: In a remarkably direct appeal by a wartime leader to policymakers in Washington, President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine made an urgent and emotional appeal to Congress on Wednesday to come to his countryâ€™s aid as it fights off a brutal Russian invasion. https://t.co/UfansM4uCs https://t.co/UN8NDvl2ym
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: More than 75 years after 400 Dutch Jews disappeared in a Nazi roundup that presaged the Holocaust, a historian set out to learn what happened to each and every one of them. She succeeded. https://t.co/GcZRNgEfBf
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
A Russian-owned superyacht is stranded in Norway because local oil suppliers refuse to refuel the ship.

The yacht is owned by the Russian oligarch Vladimir Strzhalkovsky, a former KGB agent and longtime associate of President Vladimir Putin.
https://t.co/E4ObmdHJXp https://t.co/FgN49MvVY0

nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: â€œTo be the leader of the world means to be the leader of peace,â€ President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine said, as members of Congress grew visibly emotional. Lawmakers sat rapt in their seats. Some scribbled notes and many sniffled back tears. https://t.co/rLSGaR3o3S

https://t.co/48Vvzqp90P

https://t.co/bDqg1ZahHD

nodes.title: The Senate on Tuesday voted to make Daylight Saving Time permanent. The bill, if made law, would take effect in November 2023, freeing Americans from the biannual ritual of changing clocks. https://t.co/LVF8mmYXk2 https://t.co/8ChOoQtP7o
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Brother and sister, Dmytro, 10, and Viktoriia, 8, are among the millions who fled Ukraine. Last week, they arrived for their first day of school in Italy, and students greeted them with tiny Ukrainian and Italian flags they made in classrooms a day prior. https://t.co/2oA7gPH4fF https://t.co/lUr4lJWzmf
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: In an emotional address to Canadaâ€™s Parliament, President Volodymyr Zelensky urged its members to support a no-fly zone over Ukraine, asking them to imagine cities like Vancouver or Toronto being attacked, and calling for intensifying sanctions on Russia. https://t.co/GCkyJMC85E
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Papa Johnâ€™s International said last week that it was suspending all of its corporate operations in Russia, following in the footsteps of other high-profile American brands. But an American who oversees 190 franchises there is keeping them open. https://t.co/HOpQFG8xs4
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: President Biden will travel to Brussels next week to attend an extraordinary NATO meeting over the war in Ukraine. https://t.co/CDJKoAl7mK
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: The ballistic missiles that Russia has fired into Ukraine contain a surprise, U.S. officials discovered: previously unknown decoys designed to evade air-defense systems. https://t.co/I9VKdObcMW
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Some House Democrats called for an investigation into the postmaster general's decision to buy up to 165,000 gas-powered mail trucks instead of electric over the Biden administration's objections that the contract would undermine the U.S.â€™s climate goals. https://t.co/zmA7xje5ZV

nodes.author: The New York Times

France could offer diplomatic â€œprotectionâ€ to Marina Ovsyannikova, the Russian state television employee who was detained after an on-air antiwar protest, President Emmanuel Macron said.
https://t.co/bsjKcsEg0U
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: Pierre Zakrzewski, a Fox News cameraman, was killed on Monday in Ukraine when his vehicle came under fire outside of Kyiv, the network said. He was traveling in the same vehicle as Benjamin Hall, a correspondent also injured in the attack. https://t.co/O6BIrxDORf
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine urged Russian troops to surrender.

â€œI give you a chance,â€ he said. â€œIf you surrender to our forces, we will treat you the way people are supposed to be treated â€” as people, decently.â€
https://t.co/eciyOI7ook

President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine stepped up his appeals to Russian soldiers and citizens appalled by the war, calling on them to fight to end the conflict.

https://t.co/6fjKpkLf72
